body:
Comment 1 by **ryan@rmarcus.info**: 
Well, I intended to submit a proper patch through the code review system, but I've
discovered that neither the Mercurial extension nor upload.py is capable of using an
SSL/HTTPS proxy, at least on my Windows system. Seems like a known issue:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/codereview-discuss/jlHrlKML-Ks

Attempting to use the web entry form was a hilarious experience. The complete lack of
documentation, multiple "golang" repositories (is the images "subrepo" included?), and
zero explanation of how to create a patch file or specify a base seems to indicate that
if you can't use the plugin or upload.py, you're SOL. I did, of course, attempt to
upload a diff created by HG, and got the error: "Patch set contains no recognizable
patches."

I already had to mess with code outside the scope of my job to get 16-bit TIFF decoding
working... I don't think I can muster the willpower to mess with code to get that code
reviewed. Frustration has overtaken my desire to contribute. Please excuse my
disenfranchisement. 

So here's an HG bundle from revision 13 to revision 14, which contains my fix and some
tests. The reader.go file in the original issue report also works.

I'm also attaching the raw diff file that HG generated, in case someone can't the bundle
to work.

I wish I could've contributed to the codebase, but hopefully someone looking for 16-bit
grayscale TIFF support will find this.

I should also mention my original request and discussion of this on go-lang nuts:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/golang-nuts/AG6lCHLdvFQ
Attachments: 1. 16bitpatch.diff (886187 bytes) 1. 16bittiff.bundle (647200 bytes)
